01: Basics

Source: vignettes/bregr-01-basics.Rmd
bregr-01-basics.Rmd
library(bregr)
#> Welcome to 'bregr' package!
#> =======================================================================
#> You are using bregr version 1.0.0
#> 
#> Project home : https://github.com/WangLabCSU/bregr
#> Documentation: https://wanglabcsu.github.io/bregr/
#> Cite as      : arXiv:2110.14232
#> =======================================================================
#>

#’ # Generalized Linear (GLM) Model #’ m1 <- br_set_data(data) |> #’ br_set_y(“counts”) |> #’ br_set_x(x = “outcome”, x2 = “treatment”)) |> #’ br_set_model(“poisson”) |> #’ br_run() #’ m1 #’ #’ # Cox-PH Model #’ #’ # 2. Model Batch Processing ————— #’ # 3. Group Modeling ———————–

#’ library(survival) #’ library(bregr) #’ #’ data <- data.frame( #’ counts = c(18, 17, 15, 20, 10, 20, 25, 13, 12), #’ outcome = gl(3, 1, 9), #’ treatment = gl(3, 3) #’ ) #’ #’ # 1. Single Model ————————- #’ #’ # Generalized Linear (GLM) Model #’ m1 <- br_set_data(data) |> #’ br_set_y(“counts”) |> #’ br_set_x(x = “outcome”, x2 = “treatment”)) |> #’ br_set_model(“poisson”) |> #’ br_run() #’ m1 #’ #’ # Cox-PH Model #’ #’ # 2. Model Batch Processing ————— #’ # 3. Group Modeling ———————– #’ #’ #’ br_set_data(data) |> #’ br_set_y(c(“time”, “status”)) |> #’ br_set_x(c(“age”, “sex”), “ph.ecog”) |> #’ br_set_model(“coxph”) |> #’ br_run() #’ #’ br_set_data(data) |> #’ br_set_y(c(“time”, “status”)) |> #’ br_set_x(c(“age”, “sex”), “ph.ecog”) |> #’ br_set_model(“coxph”) |> #’ br_run() #’ #’ br_set_data(data) |> #’ br_set_y(c(“time”, “status”)) |> #’ br_set_x(c(“age * sex”), “pat.karno”) |> #’ br_set_model(“coxph”) |> #’ br_run(exponentiate = TRUE, conf.level = 0.90) #’ #’ br_set_data(data) |> #’ br_set_y(c(“time”)) |> #’ br_set_x(c(“age”, “sex”), “pat.karno”) |> #’ br_set_model(‘quasi(variance = “mu”, link = “log”)’) |> #’ br_run() #’
